title: Tests failing on Windows
body:
Some tests are failing,

```

$ mvn -v
Apache Maven 3.0.3 (r1075438; 2011-02-28 18:31:09+0100)
Maven home: c:\Program Files (x86)\Development\apache-maven-3.0.3
Java version: 1.6.0_27, vendor: Sun Microsystems Inc.
Java home: c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_27\jre
Default locale: fr_FR, platform encoding: Cp1252
OS name: "windows 7", version: "6.1", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"
```

```
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 5, Failures: 2, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.002 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test
should_load_file_using_charset(org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test)  Time elapsed: 0.001 sec  <<< FAILURE!
junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<...-8, with diacritics:[]
é à> but was:<...-8, with diacritics:[
]
é à>
    at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:85)
    at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:91)
    at org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test.should_load_file_using_charset(Files_contentOf_Test.java:65)

should_load_file_using_charset_name(org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test)  Time elapsed: 0 sec  <<< FAILURE!
junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<...-8, with diacritics:[]
é à> but was:<...-8, with diacritics:[
]
é à>
    at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:85)
    at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:91)
    at org.assertj.core.util.Files_contentOf_Test.should_load_file_using_charset_name(Files_contentOf_Test.java:70)
```

It seems that when you integrate https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/pull/191 you decided to not use the 3 different txt files and the git line endings configuration but you didn't remove cd7a3af5e268ddb282866ee24a02f67f3490f0c3.

Reverting cd7a3af5e268ddb282866ee24a02f67f3490f0c3 fix the build.
